Ron,
There is a spot on the NTHK koshirae worksheet for an attribution of the complete unit to a maker, but I've not seen it used for anything mumei.  I'm not sure that it's meaningful to talk about a Jingo koshirae, or for that matter a Goto koshirae, even if all of the fittings are by one of those makers.

If the fuchigashira were submitted for kodogu shinsa (while mounted) I don't think that there would be any problem getting a Jingo attribution if that's what they are.  I don't think I've seen the tsuka, but it sounds nice.  If it turned out to be later generation Jingo, it would get a "kodai" qualifier, as with the Yagyu tsuba that Cary mentioned yesterday.

Jim



  Hi Jim - 

  As an example, I have a tsuka with nice doe skin wrap and what I believe to be Jingo iron fuchi/kashira and menuki. If this opinion is correct (Jingo), having the fittings "in hand" would show them to be mumei anyway. Do you think a shinsa team would make the call to Jingo in a case like this? I've often wondered about submitting this tsuka but that's yet to be done. (Perhaps you saw this tsuba somewhere over the years.)

  Ron
  STL
